fields.description: Details of the application which is being requested to elevate, allowing the admin to understand the identity of the application. It includes file info such as FilePath, FileHash, FilePublisher, and etc. Returned by default. Read-only.
fields.name: ApplicationDetail

fields.description: The device name used to initiate the elevation request. For example: 'cotonso-laptop'. Returned by default. Read-only.
fields.name: DeviceName

fields.description: The date and time when the elevation request was submitted/created. The value cannot be modified and is automatically populated when the elevation request is submitted/created. The Timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC time. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 would look like this: '2014-01-01T00:00:00Z'. Returned by default. Read-only.
fields.name: RequestCreatedDateTime

fields.description: Expiration set for the request when it was created, regardless of approved or denied status. For example: '2023-08-03T14:24:22Z'. Returned by default. Returned by default. Read-only.
fields.name: RequestExpiryDateTime

fields.description: Justification provided by the end user for the elevation request. For example :'Need to elevate to install microsoft word'. Read-only.
fields.name: RequestJustification

fields.description: The date and time when the elevation request was either submitted/created or approved/denied. The value cannot be modified and is automatically populated. The Timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC time. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 would look like this: '2014-01-01T00:00:00Z'. Returned by default. Read-only.
fields.name: RequestLastModifiedDateTime

fields.description: The Azure Active Directory (AAD) identifier of the end user who is requesting this elevation. For example: 'F1A57311-B9EB-45B7-9415-8555E68EDC9E'. Returned by default. Read-only.
fields.name: RequestedByUserId

fields.description: The User Principal Name (UPN) of the end user who requested this elevation. For example: 'user1@contoso.com'. Returned by default. Read-only.
fields.name: RequestedByUserPrincipalName

fields.description: The Intune Device Identifier of the managed device used to initiate the elevation request. For example: '90F5F6E8-CA09-4811-97F6-4D0DD532D916'. Returned by default. Read-only.
fields.name: RequestedOnDeviceId

fields.description: This is the Azure Active Directory (AAD) user id of the administrator who approved or denied the request. For example: 'F1A57311-B9EB-45B7-9415-8555E68EDC9E'. This field would be String.Empty before the request is either approved or denied. Read-only.
fields.name: ReviewCompletedByUserId

fields.description: This is the User Principal Name (UPN) of the administrator who approved or denied the request. For example: 'admin@contoso.com'. This field would be String.Empty before the request is either approved or denied. Read-only.
fields.name: ReviewCompletedByUserPrincipalName

fields.description: The DateTime for which the request was approved or denied. For example, midnight UTC on August 3rd, 2023 would look like this: '2023-08-03T00:00:00Z'. Read-only.
fields.name: ReviewCompletedDateTime

fields.description: An optional justification provided by approver at approval or denied time. This field will be String.Empty if approver decides to not provide a justification. For example: 'Run this installer today'
fields.name: ReviewerJustification
